Trump-Xi meeting brings temporary lull to escalation between US and China
subhead: For the first time since 2019, the American and Chinese presidents met in South Korea, amid threats that the US might resume nuclear testing. The meeting resulted in agreements on tariffs, rare earths, soybeans and fentanyl.

2026 budget bill: Voting likely delayed as wealth tax is set to be debated on Friday
subhead: The slow pace of debates, due to a proliferation of amendments, has made it unlikely that MPs will vote on the first part of the bill on November 4 as planned. The government has stuck to its decision to favor parliamentary debate and forgo forcing the budget bill through Parliament.

title: France arrests five new suspects in Louvre heist probe, says prosecutor
subhead: The five detentions took place on Wednesday in and around Paris, particularly in Seine-Saint-Denis, a department just outside the French capital.

title: 'The Smashing Machine' is a deeply tender film about one champion's vulnerabilities
subhead: Benny Safdie has made his solo directorial debut by empathetically recounting the story of an American wrestling champion overcome by doubt and addiction.

title: How Airbnb made France its favorite destination, with more than one million listings
subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (1/6). In 15 years, the platform has established itself in France, the leading tourist destination, thanks to effective lobbying and favorable tax conditions. It has even worsened the housing crisis. The company is now expanding its offerings to continue its growth.
byline: By Véronique Chocron and Jessica Gourdon

subhead: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

title: Romania's new 'National Cathedral,' the largest in the Orthodox world, sparks controversy
subhead: After 15 years of construction, the People's Salvation Cathedral in Bucharest opened its doors to the public on Sunday. A source of pride for many Romanians, it has also drawn criticism for its cost, which was largely funded by public money.

title: Too old to get a job, too young to retire: The French women over 50 stuck in limbo
subhead: In France, 21% of people aged 55-61 struggle to find work but are unable to retire. Women, who suffer more from societal inequalities throughout their career, are particularly at risk.
